title: Source: Kyler hasn't talked to Cards, refuting GM

title: After rape threats and body-shaming, influencer deletes viral Miller reel
content: A video of influencer RJ Princy Parikh with David Miller went viral after India‚Äôs loss, but she claimed she received rape threats and body-shaming abuse, prompting her to delete it from Facebook and plan a police complaint. On the field, South Africa beat India by 76 runs, bowling them out for 111. David Miller starred with 63, while Jansen and Maharaj led the bowling.

title: Watch: Turkish Air Force F-16 crashes during mission flight, pilot killed
content: A Turkish Air Force F-16 fighter jet tragically crashed during a mission flight in Balƒ±kesir early Wednesday, resulting in the pilot's death. The aircraft, from the 9th Main Jet Base Command, lost radio and radar contact shortly after takeoff. Authorities have launched an investigation into the cause of the crash, with officials offering condolences to the pilot's family.

title: Trade, defence & security on agenda as PM Modi heads to Israel
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's two-day visit to Israel, commencing Wednesday, aims to strengthen the strategic partnership and address shared challenges. The agenda includes meetings with Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu, an address to the Knesset, and discussions on technology, defense, and trade. An upgraded security pact and a potential free trade agreement are key outcomes anticipated from this significant diplomatic engagement.

title: Trump is making Google, Microsoft, Meta and others make a promise to Americans
content: President Trump is asking major technology firms to pledge that Americans will not face higher electricity bills due to expanding data centers. Companies like Google, Microsoft, and Amazon are being urged to commit to covering the costs of their significant energy consumption. This initiative aims to prevent increased utility expenses for consumers.

title: After Amma: AIADMK's struggle to fill the void left by Jayalalithaa
content: Nearly a decade after J Jayalalithaa's death, the AIADMK struggles to regain its dominance, battling leadership disputes and electoral defeats. As Tamil Nadu heads to the 2026 assembly polls, the party, now led by Edappadi Palaniswami, seeks to overcome the void left by 'Amma' and forge alliances to challenge the ruling DMK.

title: Toilet trouble: US troops feel the 'pressure' as Trump vows to flush out Khamenei regime
content: America's most advanced aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R Ford, is grappling with persistent sewage system failures during its extended deployment near the Middle East. Despite the Navy's assurances of operational readiness, the $13 billion vessel's next-generation plumbing struggles with waste from its 4,600-strong crew, leading to frequent clogs and demanding 19-hour shifts for engineers.

title: US moves closer to tougher H-1B wage norms after proposal clears federal review
content: United States is nearing changes to foreign worker wage rules. A proposed regulation impacting H-1B visas and green cards has cleared federal review. This could increase minimum wage requirements for sponsored workers. Indian professionals, who form a large part of H-1B visa holders, will be significantly affected. The revised framework may apply to the 2027 H-1B season.

title: Sam Altman at IIT-Delhi: 'Traditional career advice won‚Äôt work in the AI era'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman advised young Indians against solely relying on traditional career advice, emphasizing the need to develop and trust their own intuition in the rapidly changing AI era. He acknowledged that while some jobs will disappear, new ones will emerge, urging a balanced perspective on AI's impact and encouraging calculated risk-taking for future success.

title: Why Jake Guentzel turned down Trump‚Äôs State of the Union invitation
content: Jake Guentzel, fresh off helping Team USA win Olympic gold, did not attend the White House visit or State of the Union. Instead, he stayed in Florida to prepare for the Tampa Bay Lightning‚Äôs NHL return. While President Donald Trump honored the team in Washington, Guentzel‚Äôs absence reflected his focus on the ongoing season and his commitment to his team‚Äôs Stanley Cup pursuit.

title: ‚ÄòTea is not optional‚Äô: What living in India taught a Zambian engineering student
content: A Zambian student in India navigates cultural nuances with humor and keen observation, sharing her experiences on Instagram. From decoding the iconic head wobble to embracing the ubiquity of tea and mastering auto rickshaw rides, her journey highlights the subtle yet significant adaptations of living abroad.

title: IBM suffers worst stock rout in 25 years as Anthropic targets COBOL legacy
content: IBM faced its worst stock market day in over 25 years. Fears arose that a new AI tool from Anthropic could challenge its core business. IBM defended its mainframe platform, stating its value transcends specific programming languages like COBOL. The company highlighted its own AI investments for code modernization, emphasizing the complexity of enterprise workloads beyond simple code translation.

title: After Rs 50L reward from Bihar CM, Sooryavanshi gets new Rs 22 lakh car
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi continues to shine after a stunning IPL 2025 and U-19 World Cup 2026. He received a Tata Curvv car for winning the CURVV Super Striker award and Rs 50 lakh from Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, while BCCI announced ‚Çπ7.50 crore for the U-19 team. Vaibhav scored 175 in the World Cup final and a 35-ball IPL century, becoming the youngest debutant and centurion.

title: Candace Owens sparks backlash with investigative series on Erika Kirk
content: Candace Owens has stirred major controversy after releasing the trailer for her YouTube investigative series The Bride of Charlie, centered on Erika Kirk. The preview quickly went viral, prompting backlash, intense online debate, and questions directed at Charlie Kirk‚Äôs allies. While supporters call it accountability journalism, critics warn it risks harassment and speculation, as silence from prominent conservative voices fuels growing tension.

title: NBA trade rumor: Lakers eye $131M Cavaliers superstar in major deal
content: Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly eyeing Cleveland Cavaliers' Jarrett Allen before the 2026 trade deadline. The proposed deal involves sending Austin Reaves and future draft picks to Cleveland. This move aims to bolster the Lakers' frontcourt with much-needed size and defense, while the Cavaliers could gain scoring and guard play.

title: MLB trade rumor: Tigers target $340M Padres superstar as Cabrera successor
content: Detroit Tigers are reportedly considering a major trade for San Diego Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. This move aims to significantly strengthen their batting for the 2026 season. The Tigers would send several promising young players to San Diego in exchange for Tatis. This potential deal signals a shift for Detroit from rebuilding to actively competing.

title: 'Ramayana' opens to positive reviews after test screening: Reports
content: Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana' has reportedly received overwhelmingly positive reactions at a recent test screening in Los Angeles. Attendees praised the epic's ambitious scale, visual effects, and emotional storytelling. This feedback aims to help the makers fine-tune the film before its Diwali 2026 release, with Ranbir Kapoor, Yash, and Sai Pallavi in lead roles.

title: Graft in judiciary, cases backlog in NCERT book
content: Class 8 students will now learn about judicial challenges like corruption, massive case backlogs, and judge shortages. The new NCERT textbook highlights how these issues hinder justice, especially for the poor. It details pending cases across courts and mentions efforts to boost transparency and accountability, including a code of conduct for judges and a grievance system.

title: AI protest: Youth Congress chief Uday Bhanu Chib sent to 4-day police custody
content: Youth Congress chief Uday Bhanu Chib was remanded to four-day police custody by a Delhi court, accused of orchestrating a shirtless protest at the India AI Impact Summit. The court emphasized that claims of national security don't automatically justify lengthy custody, allowing Chib to meet his lawyer. The FIR copy was also provided, deemed crucial for his defense.

title: Is Giannis Antetokounmpo playing tonight vs Miami Heat injury update report now
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo remains sidelined with a right calf strain, missing another crucial game for the Milwaukee Bucks.  The team, already struggling without their star, faces the Miami Heat with key players needing to step up.  Miami, with fewer injury concerns, holds an advantage, particularly inside, as Milwaukee seeks perimeter scoring to compete.

title: Societies can‚Äôt function without reliable access to space, SatCom is ‚Äòdual use oxygen‚Äô: Viasat prez
content: Satellite communications are vital for modern society, enabling everything from weather forecasts to national security, Viasat's President Ben Palmer stated at DefSat 2026. He emphasized the need for resilient global SatCom and assured connectivity across various orbits and frequencies. Palmer also highlighted India's strategic approach to space sovereignty as impressive and pragmatic.

title: ChatGPT finds a new use in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli, cheating in exams
content: An AI-driven cheating racket using ChatGPT was exposed during HSC exams in Gadchiroli. Exam center staff were caught with answers generated by the AI, which were then smuggled back to students. The sophisticated method involved photographing questions, using ChatGPT for instant responses, and printing them for mass copying, marking a new low in exam fraud.

title: Jack Hughes responds to backlash over Donald Trump Olympic joke
content: Jack Hughes defended Team USA men‚Äôs hockey after backlash over President Donald Trump‚Äôs joke about the women‚Äôs team. Speaking to the Daily Mail, Hughes said people were making ‚Äúalmost nothing‚Äù into a big issue. He confirmed the team‚Äôs White House visit and stressed support for the women‚Äôs team, while his mother Ellen Hughes highlighted unity and country.

title: Jharkhand, Odisha judicial officers to be drafted to speed up Bengal SIR
content: The Supreme Court has allowed the Calcutta High Court Chief Justice to enlist judicial officers from Jharkhand and Odisha to expedite the verification of 50 lakh voters in West Bengal facing 'logical discrepancy' or 'unmapped' status. The apex court clarified Aadhaar is solely for identification, not citizenship claims, and supplementary voter lists will be published post-February 28.

title: Proud of 'babbar shers' of Youth Congress: Rahul on AI meet stir
content: Rahul Gandhi praised Indian Youth Congress members arrested for protesting the AI Summit, calling them "babbar shers" who exposed a "compromised PM." The BJP criticized Gandhi, labeling him a "running joke" and accusing him of anarchic conduct and ignorance regarding the US trade agreement.

title: Cabinet approval to rename Kerala reflects will of people of state: PM Modi
content: The Union Cabinet has approved renaming Kerala as Keralam, fulfilling a long-standing popular demand. This decision aligns with the state assembly's resolutions and reflects the will of the people. The process will involve the President referring the matter to the state assembly for its views before parliamentary action.

title: 4 dead, 11 injured after speeding bus hits two vehicles on NH-31 in Bihar‚Äôs Bhagalpur
content: A speeding bus collided head-on with two smaller vehicles on National Highway 31 in Bihar's Bhagalpur district, resulting in four fatalities, including a six-year-old boy. Eleven others were injured in the tragic accident, which occurred near Bagri Pul. Authorities are investigating the incident and plan to widen the highway to improve safety.

title: Josh Allen‚Äôs wife Hailee Steinfeld breaks silence on daily bullying
content: Josh Allen and Hailee Steinfeld are prepping for the next chapters of their lives after being married for close to a year. While the high profile couple maintain privacy about their pregnancy, Hailee Steinfeld's heartbreaking confession about being bullied has resurfaced. The BAFTA nominated actress faced heavy bullying in her younger years and was terrified of it as her life went on.

title: PM chairs 1st Cabinet meeting at Seva Teerth, pushes for reforms
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has urged his cabinet colleagues to identify and propose reforms focused on ease of living and ease of doing business. This directive follows the adoption of the 'Seva Sankalp Resolution' at Seva Teerth, emphasizing citizen-centric governance and nation-building. Ministries are expected to detail both ongoing and planned changes, with a particular focus on non-financial regulatory reforms.

title: Dinesh Lal Yadav confesses he never loved his wife in 26 years of 'forced' marriage
content: Bhojpuri superstar Dinesh Lal Yadav, popularly known as Nirahua, has once again grabbed headlines ‚Äî this time for his candid remarks about his personal life. The actor, who has been married to Mansha Devi since 2000 and is a father to two sons, opened up about his marriage and his views on love during a recent interaction, sparking conversations across social media and entertainment circles.

title: Katrina Kaif makes first public appearance after welcoming baby Vihaan
content: After embracing motherhood, Katrina Kaif has largely stayed away from the public eye. The actor, who welcomed her first child ‚Äî baby boy Vihaan ‚Äî with husband Vicky Kaushal on November 7, 2025, recently made her first appearance since delivery, delighting fans.

title: How can Pakistan reach T20 WC semi-final after England defeat?
content: Pakistan‚Äôs semi-final hopes remain alive despite losing to England, who qualified after Harry Brook‚Äôs century chase of 164. Pakistan have one point from two games and must beat Sri Lanka in their final match. They also need New Zealand to lose both games to qualify directly, or else hope to edge them on net run rate. Any other results will eliminate Pakistan from the T20 World Cup.

title: PAK vs ENG: Pakistan fan's hilarious reaction after Saim Ayub dismissal goes viral - Watch

content: Amid soaring geopolitical tensions between Washington and Tehran, India has advised all its nationals, including students, in Iran to leave by any available transport as soon as possible.

title: 'What Difference It Makes?' Shashi Tharoor Questions Kerala Name Change
content: Shashi Tharoor, in a separate post on X, had a "small linguistic question" - what happens now to the terms "Keralite" and "Keralan" for the "denizens" of the new "Keralam".

title: Maharashtra Man Steals Mother's Jewellery From Home, Arrested Within Hours
content: A 30-year-old man stole his mother's gold ornaments from home in Latur district of Maharashtra and was held within hours of the crime, police said.

title: PM Modi To Begin His Israel Visit Today, Defence And Trade On Agenda
content: India and Israel's relations will be upgraded to a "special strategic partnership" during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit, marking a "significant leap ahead" similar to Jerusalem's ties with countries such as the US and Germany, sources said.

title: UK Imposes New Travel Permit Requirement On These Foreign Visitors
content: Starting on Wednesday, visitors to Britain from 85 countries must obtain an electronic permit in advance of their trip or they will be barred from travelling, the UK interior ministry said.

title: Inside Mexican Country Villa That Became El Mencho's Final Refuge
content: The two-storey residence at No. 39 with stone walls and a red-tiled roof served as a discreet hideout for El Mencho, the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), who died on Sunday after a military ambush in the woods behind the home.

title: Sasikala Floats New Party, Unveils Flag Featuring Jayalalithaa Ahead Of Polls
content: Sasikala recalled the humiliation Jayalalithaa allegedly faced after the death of AIADMK founder M G Ramachandran.

title: Horse Handler In Mumbai Gets 2 Years In Jail For Girl's Death Due To Fall
content: A sessions court here on Tuesday sentended a horse handler to two years' rigorous imprisonment for the tragic death of a six-year-old girl in 2017.

title: Epstein Victims To Attend Trump's Speech Today, Demand Accountability
content: Victims of Jeffrey Epstein will attend US President Donald Trump's State of the Union address on Tuesday and are seeking accountability for the crimes of the convicted sex offender, lawmakers said.

title: Louvre's Director Resigns Months After Mega Jewels Heist In Paris
content: The director of the Louvre Museum, who had been under fire since the stunning and embarrassing heist of the French Crown jewels in October, has stepped down from the position, French President Emmanuel Macron's office said Tuesday.

title: Delhi Teen Killed, Neck Broken As Cricket Match Argument Turns Violent
content: A neighbourhood cricket game turned deadly in west Delhi's Tilak Nagar after a 15-year-old boy allegedly had his neck broken in a violent confrontation with three juveniles, police said on Tuesday.

title: India Abstains In UN Vote On Immediate Ceasefire Between Ukraine, Russia
content: India on Tuesday abstained in the UN General Assembly on a draft resolution that called for an immediate, full and unconditional ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine.

title: In Pics: Zelensky Aged Visibly By War's Toll, Putin Frozen Exactly Since 2022
content: The contrast between Volodymyr Zelensky and Vladimir Putin is one of the most defining visual stories of the war itself.

title: Sikh Man Kidnapped In Daylight, Killed In California Mistaken-Identity Case
content: A 57-year-old Sikh man of Indian origin was kidnapped and murdered in California in a horrific case of mistaken identity on Tuesday. Avtar Singh was abducted in broad daylight from Tracy, which is an hour from San Jose.

title: Shots Fired At Bishnoi Gang Lawyer's Vehicle By Men On Bike In Delhi
content: A car carrying a lawyer who is part of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's legal team, was shot at in Delhi on Tuesday. Besides the lawyer, there were four others in the car, which wastargetted near the Delhi's Kashmere Gate inter-state bus stand.

title: After El Mencho's Death, Cartels Turn To Fake News To Spread Fear In Mexico
content: After Mexican forces killed the country's most wanted cartel leader on Sunday, false accounts of spectacular violence swept across social media, fueled by what researchers say was a coordinated propaganda campaign by organised crime.

title: Centre Approves 5,000 Houses In Manipur For People Displaced By Ethnic Violence
content: The construction of 5,000 houses were approved for the rehabilitation of internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Manipur under the Pradhan Mantri Awass Yojna-Gramin (PMAY-G).

title: MMA divisional rankings: Heavyweight top 10 is light on changes or impact

title: Need mechanism to make voting mandatory: Supreme Court
content: a bench of CJI Surya Kant and justice Joymalya Bagchi said the nota option was devised to attract better candidates to the fray . the decade-long experience shows that a minuscule percentage of voters exercised the option .

title: Ever noticed ‚Äòheight above sea level‚Äô boards at railway stations? Here‚Äôs what it means
content: height above sea level plays an important role in railway operations, engineering, safety planning, and even weather monitoring . in india, this reference is called the mean sea level . it is measured using long-term observations of sea levels, usually taken at coastal locations .

title: Worked for 50 years at one company, 70-year-old manager fired without farewell or severance
content: a former worker shared that his manager was suddenly fired without a farewell event or severance pay . this account shows older workers are still worried about job security and how things are done at work . the account shows the length of service and the lack of formal separation benefits, which many workers expect after decades with a company .

title: Aviation regulator mulls stricter fines, safety ranks for charter ops
content: india may soon rank non scheduled operator permit (NSOP) or charter and private jet operators based on their safety record . this ranking is proposed to be released on the directorate general of civil aviation's website . there will now be stricter penalties for operators violating norms regarding aircraft or crew utilisation .

title: India to launch HPV vax drive for 14-year-old girls this month
content: Anuja Jaiswal is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with an impressive 18-year career in narrative journalism. She specializes in health and heritage reporting, expertly simplifying complex health information to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience. Over the years, she has worked in Chandigarh, Chhattisgarh and West UP, gaining diverse on-ground experience that shapes her storytelling. Read More

title: India, Israel condemn terror attacks, review emerging threats
content: the two sides unequivocally condemn terrorism in all its forms . they reaffirm zero tolerance in a joint statement . the statement follows a meeting of a working group on counterterrorism . both sides renewed commitment to multilateral cooperation .

title: Trade grades: What can Brett Kulak do for the Avalanche?
content: the 2025-26 NHL trade season continues now that the Olympics and the Olympic roster freeze are over . the Vancouver Canucks traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights in exchange for a package that included defenseman Zach Whitecloud .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: No one loves late drama like Liverpool. What's behind their taste for theatrics?
content: arsenal beat Nottingham Forest 1-0 in the premier league on sunday afternoon . the win is the latest dramatic installment in a campaign characterized by last-gasp winners . it is a quirk that has inflicted both joy and misery on head coach arne slot's side .

title: Hooked on hockey after the Olympics? An updated look at the NHL's playoff picture
content: the NHL paused its season to allow its players to compete in the 2026 winter Olympics in Italy . around 143 players saw action in the Olympic men's hockey tournament . some return as bitter runners-ups, others as new minted gold medalists .

title: Week 3 Top 25 and how to watch
content: Sophia Knight was named SEC Player of the Week after going 11-for-13 last week . she has recorded eight multi-hit games and is hitting .543 through the first 14 games of the season . here is the complete scoreboard here to stay up to date this spring .

title: Kings of the hot corner: Buster Olney ranks baseball's best third basemen
content: we rank the best of the best at third base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career.
